009package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.LinearMapping2D;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
018import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
019import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
020import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022
023/**
024 * This plugin demonstrates the use of geometric mappings, as implemented
025 * in the imagingbook library.
026 * A {@link ProjectiveMapping2D} (transformation) is specified by 4
027 * corresponding point pairs, given by point sequences P and Q.
028 * The inverse mapping is required for target-to-source mapping.
029 * The actual pixel transformation is performed by an {@link ImageMapper} object.
030 * Try on a suitable test image and check if the image corners (P) are
031 * mapped to the points specified in Q.
032 * This plugin works for all image types.
033 * The transformed image is shown in a new window, the prigina√∂
034 * image remains unchanged.
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2021/10/03
038 *
039 * @see LinearMapping2D
040 * @see ProjectiveMapping2D
041 * @see ImageMapper
042 */
043public class Map_Projective implements PlugInFilter {
044        
045        static Pnt2d[] P = {
046                        Pnt2d.from(0, 0),
047                        Pnt2d.from(400, 0),
048                        Pnt2d.from(400, 400),
049                        Pnt2d.from(0, 400)};
050
051        static Pnt2d[] Q = {
052                        Pnt2d.from(0, 60),
053                        Pnt2d.from(400, 20),
054                        Pnt2d.from(300, 400),
055                        Pnt2d.from(30, 200)};
056
057        private ImagePlus im;
058        
059        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
060                this.im = im;
061                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;
062        }
063
064        public void run(ImageProcessor source) {
065                int W = source.getWidth();
066                int H = source.getHeight();
067                
068                // create the target image:
069                ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(W, H); 
070                
071                // create the target-to source mapping, i.e. Q -> P. 
072                // there are 2 alternatives:
073                LinearMapping2D m = ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(P, Q);               // P -> Q, then invert
074                LinearMapping2D mi = m.getInverse();            
075                //Mapping2D mi = ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(Q, P);  // Q -> P = inverse mapping
076
077                // create a mapper instance:
078                ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(mi, OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
079                
080                // apply the mapper:
081                mapper.map(source, target);
082                
083                // display the target image:
084                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-transformed", target).show();
085                
086                IJ.log("A = \n" + Matrix.toString(m.getTransformationMatrix()));
087        }
088}
